caption: b"A mid-week pick-me-up? This should do the trick. We couldn't be happier to be named one of the #BestWorkplaces for Parents by @gptw_us for the second year in a row. In the midst of this year's challenges, we've found new ways to support Splunkers and their families, and have been impressed by how they've shown up in creative ways at work and at home. So today we say, cheers to all of you - and to our Little Splunkers, too! #splunklife #GreatPlacetoParent"

b'Like the cherry on top of a sundae \xe2\x80\x93\xc2\xa0or in this case, the candles on a cake \xe2\x80\x93\xc2\xa0we\xe2\x80\x99re bidding adieu to #VeteransMonth with one last celebration. To honor the veterans in our Splunk family, we adopted the U.S. Marine Corps\xe2\x80\x99\xc2\xa0birthday cake tradition and added a Splunky little twist, sending celebratory cakes to the longest-tenured and newest Splunk veterans as a reminder that in the best times and in the worst times, we\xe2\x80\x99re all united by the same core values and mission. Take a look at how Splunkers Tim Foley and Bill Bryant celebrated at home. #splunklife'

b"Who served in both the British and Australian armed services, is an experienced technology and sales professional, *and* is a guest lecturer at Le Cordon Bleu? Well, that'd be Sydney-based Splunker Neil Gow. Yep, really - he's a man of many talents, and we're thrilled to have the opportunity to celebrate him and all of the Splunkers who have served all #VeteransMonth long. #splunklife"

b"A native of New York (City, that is) and first-generation American with deep roots in the island of Grenada, Splunker Neal Andrew had a rich 15-year career in the US Marine Corps, during which he served in six worldwide deployments and was honored with a Purple Heart. He went on to serve the #PublicSector in a civilian role for a decade, and now is a Global Account Manager for the US Navy and US Marines accounts here at Splunk. Thank you, Neal - we're proud to have you on our team! #VeteransMonth #splunklife"

b'Did you know that we have year-round Splunkterns? That\xe2\x80\x99s right - this fall, we\xe2\x80\x99ve got 45+ interns across all areas of our organization, like Cinthia Salazar, Early Career Talent Operations #Splunktern and @yearup student. Check out what she had to say about her Splunky experience so far above.\n\nInterested in joining our team? Well then, head on over to splk.it/careers to learn all about #splunklife.'

b"Before becoming a Splunker, Chris Wilson had an impressive 23-year career in the U.S. Air Force, where he worked his way up to Master Sergeant and served as an Intelligence Analyst and Military Advisor all over the world. He found his way to our team through a Veteran internship program, and here's what he had to say about his 'Vet-tern' experience: \xe2\x80\x9cI feel very fortunate that I was given the opportunity for an internship at Splunk. Having a community of Veterans that understands the struggles you are going through really helped with my transition to the civilian workplace. At times it was very difficult, Splunk only hires the very best people so the standards are high with a steep learning curve. Fortunately, everyone is supportive and generous with their knowledge. It\xe2\x80\x99s a great place to work and I couldn\xe2\x80\x99t be happier.\xe2\x80\x9d #VeteransMonth #splunklife"

b'A retired four-star U.S. Army General, Executive Vice President at @BoozAllen, and now the newest member of our Board of Directors. Please join us in extending Dennis Via a very warm welcome as he brings his over 40 years of military, technology and public sector leadership experience to Splunk. The thing he\xe2\x80\x99s most looking forward to? \xe2\x80\x9cSupporting the company\xe2\x80\x99s vision of creating lasting data outcomes for their customers.\xe2\x80\x9d Welcome, Dennis \xe2\x80\x93 we\xe2\x80\x99re lucky to have you! #VeteransMonth'

b'This #VeteransDay, we\'re celebrating the nearly 80 Splunkers who have selflessly served in the armed forces.\n\nAmong them is Splunker Shanikqua Tucker \xe2\x80\x93 while in the U.S. Army Reserves, she served as an Intelligence Analyst and assisted command posts across the east coast, and now at Splunk, she works as a Senior Solutions Engineer for the U.S. Army account. Pretty cool, right? Even cooler is Shanikqua\'s commitment to creating communities within the workplace, and she\'s known to give impromptu motivational speeches to her mentees and teammates about leadership, self-care...you name it. So, with that, we\'ll leave you with her personal motto: "May your actions speak louder than your words!" #VeteransMonth #splunklife'

b"We say, why limit honoring our military veterans and reservists to just one day? That's right \xe2\x80\x93 we're embracing the opportunity to acknowledge the role veterans play in our global community and within our Splunk family, all #VeteransMonth long.\n\nThis year, we're kicking things off by spotlighting SLED Sales Engineer and Coast Guardsman, Mandy Pearson. Before joining our team, she worked as a Marine Science Technician in the Coast Guard, investigating oil spills and inspecting oil refineries and foreign freight ships for eight years. Eventually, her passion for tech shifted her course and led her to meet a few Splunkers at a #WomenInTech event in Atlanta. And, as they say, the rest is history! We're proud to have you on our team, Mandy. #splunklife"

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s about that time \xe2\x80\x93 yep, that\xe2\x80\x99s right, it\xe2\x80\x99s time to #vote. We\xe2\x80\x99re proud to see Splunkers around the world showing up with their family and friends to make sure their voices are heard. Here are just a few reasons why voting matters to our team:

\xe2\x80\x9cI remember going to the polls with my mother as a child, and she instilled the importance of voting in me at a young age. Now I encourage all my peers to vote in every election, not just the big ones. Your vote matters, you matter.\xe2\x80\x9d - Aminah McKinnie

\xe2\x80\x9cIt has never been more important to express your opinion and make your voice heard by voting. President Barack Obama said it best: \xe2\x80\x99There\xe2\x80\x99s no such thing as a vote that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t matter. It all matters.\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x93 Lucas Mast

\xe2\x80\x9cVoting doesn\xe2\x80\x99t cost a thing and I know my vote matters. My husband and I have been voting together for every single election since we first started dating almost 13 years ago.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x93 Candace Raleigh'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re not just talkin\xe2\x80\x99 the talk when it comes to voting \xe2\x80\x93 oh no, we want to be sure that Splunkers have the opportunity to have their voices heard. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we\xe2\x80\x99ve made Election Day a global company holiday, ensuring that each and every one of our teammates can take the time they need to cast their ballot. \n\nFor EMEA Director of Marketing Communications, Alice Crook, voting is important because it helps determine our future and sets a good example for the next generation. (And you never know \xe2\x80\x93 those little ones may be Splunkers one day, we\xe2\x80\x99ll let them decide.) To learn more about how we\xe2\x80\x99re enabling voters to expand their election knowledge, follow the link in our bio.'

b'Get out and V O T E! We\xe2\x80\x99re one week away from election day in the United States, so we asked Splunkers \xe2\x80\x93 why do *you* cast your ballot? We\xe2\x80\x99ll let Public Sector Global Account Manager, Neal Andrew, kick things off: \xe2\x80\x9cI voted [early] as a first generation American, who is Black, and have voted in general and local elections for over 10 years! This year, the down ballot elections have a more lasting effect.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nWant to learn more about current election patterns and trends? #SplunkForGood has your back. Follow the link in our bio to explore our new public dashboards that display and redistribute non-partisan data. #splunklife'

b'Get out and V O T E! We\xe2\x80\x99re one week away from election day in the United States, so we asked Splunkers \xe2\x80\x93 why do *you* cast your ballot? We\xe2\x80\x99ll let Public Sector Global Account Manager, Neal Andrew, kick things off: \xe2\x80\x9cI voted [early] as a first generation American, who is Black, and have voted in general and local elections for over 10 years! This year, the down ballot elections have a more lasting effect.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nWant to learn more about current election patterns and trends? #SplunkForGood has your back. Follow the link in our bio to explore our new public dashboards that display and redistribute non-partisan data. #splunklife'

b'Well, you know what they say, all good things must come to an end - but we *really* weren\xe2\x80\x99t prepared to say goodbye to #splunkconf20 so soon. From kicking off with #SplunkBOTS and #SplunkBOTN, then heading straight into our latest product announcements, insights from some very special guests, and, of course, many moments of learning and connecting in between - what a week it has been! And hey, might as well mark your calendar now for #splunkconf21 - see you there October 18-21, 2021.'

b"Actress. Activist. Mother. Swimmer. Nature Lover. Those are just a few of #splunkconf20 guest speaker Kerry Washington's #MillionDataPoints. DEI is in our company\xe2\x80\x99s DNA, so we were thrilled to see our Chief Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Officer, Suzanne McGovern, sit down with Kerry during .conf20 to chat all things data, democracy, and equity. #splunklife"

b'Where in the world are you watching #splunkconf20? We asked, and oh boy, Splunkers sure delivered. From home offices, to the beach, with family, and you know we can\xe2\x80\x99t leave out our favorite four-legged friends \xe2\x80\x93 .conf20 is all about creating your own incredible experience. (And hey, a few special guests never hurts either.) #splunklife'

b"Bigger and just as great of a group as ever \xe2\x80\x93 you know we couldn't do #splunkconf20 without welcoming a few new fez's to the #SplunkTrust family (15, to be exact). Hats off to our newest inductees, and welcome back to our returning members!"

b'Who is Shelly Kornbloom? Sure, he\xe2\x80\x99s the VP of Marketing Special Ops and Catering at the #SplunkTShirtCo \xe2\x80\x93 but he\xe2\x80\x99s so much more. Well, okay, maybe just a little more. As one of the company\xe2\x80\x99s three original founders, Shelly helped turn a fledgling startup into the 11th largest t-shirt company in the world! (Or maybe it\xe2\x80\x99s the 1111th largest.) Either way, he\xe2\x80\x99s in his office/laundry room and ready to take over our Stories ahead of #splunkconf20 for some exclusive \xe2\x80\x98ask me anything\xe2\x80\x99 action. Let\xe2\x80\x99s do this.'

b'If you haven\xe2\x80\x99t noticed, we\xe2\x80\x99re doing things a little differently around here this year. So how does one take all the unforgettable experiences and connections of .conf and make them virtual, you ask? Okay, okay, we gave this one away \xe2\x80\x93 with Twitch, of course. We\xe2\x80\x99ve got some Splunky streams, special #splunkconf20 guests, and more on our calendar \xe2\x80\x93 subscribe at twitch.tv/splunkinc and we\xe2\x80\x99ll see you there!'

b'This isn\xe2\x80\x99t your average fireside chat. Nope, not at all. Consider this your official invite to cozy up next to the Data Log at #splunkconf20 and listen in on an enlightening discussion between our own Carrie Palin and actor, producer, and writer Will Ferrell about Will\xe2\x80\x99s career and creative process. Follow the link in our bio to save this to your .conf20 schedule right now.'

b"Ah, remember your first .conf? The energy, the experiences - oh, right...and the whole 'being in-person' part. And while Puja Rani\xe2\x80\x99s first .conf experience won\xe2\x80\x99t look quite like that, she\xe2\x80\x99s not letting that dull her excitement. Much like the Splunk Community, #splunkconf20 \xe2\x80\x9cprovides a forum where people across the world can connect, help, learn, share their knowledge, and have fun.\xe2\x80\x9d\n\nWe\xe2\x80\x99re just a few days away from .conf20, and to say we\xe2\x80\x99re excited would be an understatement. Make sure you\xe2\x80\x99ve got your schedule set - follow our #linkinbio to personalize your virtual experience."

b'Like to push boundaries? Yep, we thought so. So our gift to you at #splunkconf20? Two of the biggest boundary pushers: the world-famous hacker, @kevinmitnick.official, and award-winning programmer and legendary video game designer, @theromero. Check out the details for their sessions at the link in our bio.'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s safe to say there\xe2\x80\x99s a lot we\xe2\x80\x99ll miss about hosting #splunkconf20 in-person this year, and that nostalgia hasn\xe2\x80\x99t missed #SplunkTrust member Martin Mu\xcc\x88ller either. His top memorable moments? A little thing he likes to call \xe2\x80\x9challway-con: meeting people and chatting, diving into deep technical details while having food and drinks together.\xe2\x80\x9d And, of course, \xe2\x80\x9cin-person #SplunkBOTS and #SplunkBOTN - the atmosphere of a thousand brains churning in a room is irreplaceable.\xe2\x80\x9d \n\nBut let\xe2\x80\x99s be honest, there will be *one* thing we won\xe2\x80\x99t miss as much, and as Martin points out, that\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9csharing WiFi with 11,000 of your closest friends.\xe2\x80\x9d Learn more about Martin at splk.it/HTSMartinMuller.'

b'Oh, you know, just dropping in for some fun. Wait, no, we mean literally. That\xe2\x80\x99s right - skateboarding legend, @tonyhawk, and master sommelier, @alpanasingh, will be stopping by #splunkconf20 to show off a few tricks of their trades. Check out the link in our bio to find out more.'

b'Mary Cordova had a non-traditional career path and learning how to use Splunk added to her diverse and marketable skill set. But, like all of us, she needed a little extra support when she was just getting started, so who\xe2\x80\x99d she turn to? The #SplunkTrust, of course. \n\n\xe2\x80\x9cWithout their engagement, I don\xe2\x80\x99t know if I would have succeeded to the extent I have, and I\xe2\x80\x99m honored that they have seen and recognized me, and welcomed me as a member of the Trust. I hope I do my part to welcome and support the others the way that I was.\xe2\x80\x9d Stay tuned to meet more of the Splunk Community as we head into #splunkconf20. Want to know more? Head over to splk.it/HTSMaryCordova to meet Mary.'

b'Need a break from the data deluge during #splunkconf20? We\xe2\x80\x99ve got you covered. How, you ask? Well, how about with inspiring and energizing sessions with chef and humanitarian, @chefjoseandres, and actress and activist, @kerrywashington. And that\xe2\x80\x99s really just the beginning. Click the link in our bio to find out more.'

b'The clock is ticking - #splunkconf20 is less than two weeks (!) away. And the one big thing we\xe2\x80\x99ll be missing the most this year? Connecting with all the \xe2\x80\x98Humans that Splunk\xe2\x80\x99 in real life. So what are we gonna do about it? Glad you asked. We\xe2\x80\x99re bringing the Splunk community to you - yep, right here. \n\nRich Galloway is now a seasoned member of the #SplunkTrust, but once upon a time he was new to the Splunk Community and thought it was *just* a great resource to learn how to use our products. All that changed as he \xe2\x80\x9csoon learned that it\xe2\x80\x99s full of people who care and want to help as much as I do. The part I\'ll miss most this year is getting together with other members of the SplunkTrust." Go to splk.it/HTSRichGalloway to get to know Rich.'

b'Wasting money on t-shirts you never wear? Oh no, not on our watch. Lucky for you, that\xe2\x80\x99s where our new #SplunkTShirtCo offering, T-SaaS, comes in. Pay for what you use and not a penny more - check it out here.'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re still holding onto the last bits of summer over here \xe2\x80\x93 and by that we mean we\xe2\x80\x99re just not quite ready to say goodbye to our summer #Splunktern group. So what was the biggest lesson Solutions Engineer intern, Michelle Vasiliadis, took away from her experience? We\xe2\x80\x99ll let her tell you in her own words: \xe2\x80\x9cBe comfortable with being uncomfortable. Putting yourself in unchartered territory will help you feel more comfortable when situations arise unexpectedly. If you fail, you\xe2\x80\x99ll get used to bouncing back, and if you succeed, you\xe2\x80\x99ll get used to growing.\xe2\x80\x9d \n\nInterested in joining our team? Check out splk.it/careers to learn all about #splunklife.'

b'From folkl\xc3\xb3rico to first-generation STEM careers, our Somos ERG is a huge part of what makes our #MillionDataPoints culture so special. And in celebration of #LatinxHeritageMonth, we\xe2\x80\x99re spotlighting the talents and experiences that make each and every member so unique. Take a look. #splunklife'

b'Starting the week on a high note? Yep, we\xe2\x80\x99re all about it. Okay, okay, we know you\xe2\x80\x99ve been waiting for this, so we won\xe2\x80\x99t hold things up any longer - say hello to our #splunkconf20 Session Catalog. Ready to personalize your virtual experience? Check out this step-by-step guide and then head on over to the link in our bio to start curating your agenda.'

b'Same SHET, different day. Say what? Oh, we\xe2\x80\x99re talking about SHET - the latest in t-shirt technology from the #SplunkTShirtCo, of course. See what it\xe2\x80\x99s all about right here. #splunklife'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s that time of year again \xe2\x80\x93 nope, we\xe2\x80\x99re not talking about pumpkin spice season: it\xe2\x80\x99s university recruitment season! We\xe2\x80\x99re excited to recruit our next #Splunktern class, and we\xe2\x80\x99ll be (virtually) popping up at over 60 university events around the world this fall.\n\nWant to know where we\xe2\x80\x99ll be \xe2\x80\x98on campus\xe2\x80\x99 this month? Tap our photo to see if your school is tagged \xe2\x80\x93 if it is, well it\xe2\x80\x99s your lucky day \xe2\x80\x93 go to splk.it/universityrecruiting to get more details. #splunklife'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99ve got a lot to celebrate this weekend. Like what, you might ask? We\xe2\x80\x99re thrilled to be named one of the #BestWorkplaces for Women by @fortunemag and @gptw_us for the second year in a row. See why our #MillionDataPoints culture stands out to #WomenInTech. #splunklife'

b'You\xe2\x80\x99ve probably noticed that our t-shirts are almost as popular as our software. (And if you haven\xe2\x80\x99t noticed \xe2\x80\x93 well, where have you been?). Now, we\xe2\x80\x99re taking you behind the scenes of the Splunk T-Shirt Company to show you why Splunkers and customers collect, cherish, and, of course, wear the heck out of our shirts. Take a peek. #splunklife'

b'#splunkconf20: still social, now distant. But rest assured, we\xe2\x80\x99ll stop at nothing short of bringing our A-game when it comes to planning interactive, educational, and Splunky content for our biggest (virtual) event of the year. Have you registered? Follow the link in our bio to get started.'

b'Goodbye, summer - \xe2\x80\x98tis the season to race towards #splunkconf20. Wait, *race*? Yep, you read that right - data is driving the future of #F1 and we\xe2\x80\x99re along for the ride. We\xe2\x80\x99ve teamed up with @mclaren to deliver insights and fuel innovation on the track (both virtually and IRL), so their team can keep their eye on the prize. Get revved up for .conf20 at our #linkinbio. #DataToEverything #WeRaceAsOne'

b'In case you haven\xe2\x80\x99t noticed, we\xe2\x80\x99re pretty big dog lovers around here. What can we say? Regardless of whether it\xe2\x80\x99s #NationalDogDay or just a regular Wednesday \xe2\x80\x93 we think the best WFH desk views look a little like this. #splunklife'

b'Splunk + Intern = #Splunktern. It\xe2\x80\x99s simple math, really. It\xe2\x80\x99s #NationalInternDay, and we are excited to have a whole day dedicated to celebrating our Splunkterns! From virtual coffee chats to Zoom meet and greets to dressing up (or dressing down), our summer interns truly made the most of their remote internships. And lucky us, they shared some highlights from their experiences \xe2\x80\x93 check out our Story for more. #splunklife'

b"Forget airfare and hotel reservations - we're bringing #splunkconf20 straight to you, wherever that is! Yep, from the people and ideas, to the content and the sharing, and, of course, a whole lot of Splunkiness, everything you know and love will be at our first-ever virtual .conf. And the best news of all? Registration is officially open. Head on over to the link in our bio to save your spot."

b'Weightlifter. Academic. Baker. Artist. Runner. Splunker. We are all a #MillionDataPoints \xe2\x80\x93 and we really can\xe2\x80\x99t think of a better note to end #PrideMonth on than by giving Splunkers the spotlight to celebrate exactly who they are, in their own words. Swipe to see it all. #splunklife'

b'More words of wisdom from longtime allies here at Splunk? Count us in. This #PrideMonth, we\xe2\x80\x99re celebrating and showing up for the LGBTQ+ community with more #Pride than ever. Want to join us? C\xe2\x80\x99mon then, check out the link in our bio for a few resources to inspire your allyship practice. #splunklife'

b"#PrideMonth around the world is associated with vibrant rainbows, pride flags, and, of course, parades. And while we\xe2\x80\x99re obviously big fans of the festivities, we know it's even more important to acknowledge the individuals who propelled the LGBTQ+ community forward and fought for these celebrations. Check out our Story for a feature on just a few of these heroes on #SplunkBlogs. (And while we\xe2\x80\x99re at it, huge shout out to Splunker @jeffsredni, who created these original illustrations!)"

b'The first step to being an active ally to the LGBTQ+ community? Well, it\xe2\x80\x99s pretty simple: show up. That\xe2\x80\x99s something longtime allies here at Splunk know firsthand. Check out our #linkinbio for more of their words of wisdom and resources to help improve your allyship practice. #PrideMonth #splunklife'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s about that time of year again \xe2\x80\x93 yep, break out those caps and gowns, it\xe2\x80\x99s graduation season! For the class of 2020, that looks a little more like virtual ceremonies and car parades than in-person spectacles, but that\xe2\x80\x99s not going to stop us from celebrating. Shout out to all of our not-so-little Splunkers who are moving onwards and upwards this year! #WeAreSplunk #splunklife'

b"Now, more than ever, it's essential for the LGBTQ+ community to have strong and supportive allies. But what does allyship *really* look like? Well, we turned to a few longtime allies at Splunk to get their thoughts and resources for self-education. Head to our #linkinbio to see what they had to say. #PrideMonth #splunklife"

b'In this time of ongoing unrest across the United States and around the world, every single one of us must be part of the process, committed to speaking up, and to listening; to improving our society and growing as individuals. Our CEO, Doug Merritt, shares more on the commitment we\xe2\x80\x99re making at Splunk at the link in our bio.'

b'#PrideMonth is a celebration of the LGBTQ+ community and what it brings. This year, we\xe2\x80\x99re leaning into a future of equality and acceptance with excitement, hope, and - you guessed it - an extra dose of #Pride. Follow our #linkinbio to learn more from our CMO, Carrie Palin. #splunklife'
b'#BlackoutTuesday'

b'Whether you\xe2\x80\x99re working in a home office or at the kitchen table (okay, or *maybe* from the couch), we\xe2\x80\x99re here to help you thrive in the #data age. Ready to see how bringing #DataToEverything can give your (remote) work life a boost? Click our #linkinbio to find out.'

b'Caught catching some zzz\xe2\x80\x99s on the job. But we can\xe2\x80\x99t lie, we might just have to take a cue from these Splunkers\xe2\x80\x99 four-legged friends while making our weekend plans. #splunklife'

b'Our new mantra: just \xe2\x80\x9croll\xe2\x80\x9d with it. When we shifted to working from home, we didn\xe2\x80\x99t want our teams to lose their close connections - and Splunkers have not disappointed. Grab a tissue (or a little TP, if you can spare a square) and enjoy Peter Polizzi\xe2\x80\x99s and Toni Pavlovich\xe2\x80\x99s story about how a surprise shipment of hard-to-find toilet paper saved the day. #WeAreSplunk #splunklife'

b'Virtual dumpling making? Go on, we\xe2\x80\x99re listening. Okay, so it\xe2\x80\x99s not *quite* like sharing a meal IRL, but we can always count on Splunkers to make the most of any situation. See how our APAC team squeezed in a little team bonding and served up some fresh, homemade dumplings while they were at it. #splunklife'

b'Surfing, puddle jumping, pasta making, Star Wars-celebrating (of course) \xe2\x80\x93 but, most importantly, resting. Look, we could all use some self-care during these times, so we thought \xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x99why not make a day of it?\xe2\x80\x9d Yes, really! Yesterday, Splunkers around the world had the day all to themselves to do whatever it is that makes them feel balanced and rested. Swipe to see how they spent it. #splunklife'

b"Walkin\xe2\x80\x99 into the weekend like\xe2\x80\xa6 \nStaying covered (we're talkin' head-to-toe covered) and bringing a smile to everyone in the neighborhood? Check. Splunker Craig Fox and family got a little creative for their daily walk, and well, we\xe2\x80\x99re here for it. #splunklife"

b'#BringYourKidToWorkDay sure looks different this year, but you know we couldn\xe2\x80\x99t pass up the opportunity to shine a spotlight on our Little Splunkers. We\xe2\x80\x99ve got dancers, musicians, athletes - oh my! Take a look at this talented bunch. #splunklife'

b'Mondays are a little better with a #WFH mascot. Splunker Heather Ceran\xe2\x80\x99s pup Maddy knows the secrets to a successful remote workday: a walk around the block, a stash of treats, and quality time on the couch. #splunklife'
b'Hey, you \xe2\x80\x93 yep, we\xe2\x80\x99re talking to you. Just interrupting your Saturday to spread a little bit of sunshine from Splunker Courtney Nguyen and family. #splunklife'

b'Paging the Tooth Fairy. Splunker Justin Schiavo got to be a part of a very special \xe2\x80\x9cfirst\xe2\x80\x9d last week \xe2\x80\x93 yep, his little one lost their first tooth! Who says staying home isn\xe2\x80\x99t exciting? No, really \xe2\x80\x93 as our teams around the world spend more time at home, it brings a smile to our faces to know that more moments like these will be happening. #splunklife'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s no secret that our workdays are looking a little, um, different these days. And for many of our employees, having their four-legged friends close by for companionship and some comedic relief is making all the difference. Take it from Splunker Robert Halton, whose pup Maxwell keeps him on track with all of his to-do\xe2\x80\x99s. #splunklife'

b'They say all good things must come to an end, but this year\xe2\x80\x99s #WomensHistoryMonth theme, #EachForEqual, is something we can celebrate all year long. So, we\xe2\x80\x99ll wrap up the month by celebrating a few of the unique qualities that inspire San Francisco-based Content Marketing Manager, Stefanie Hoffman: \xe2\x80\x9cI am a parent, mental health activist and advocate, writer, traveler, and dancer.\xe2\x80\x9d (If you\xe2\x80\x99re not quite ready to say goodbye \xe2\x80\x93 well, we get it. See all of this month\xe2\x80\x99s spotlights at our #linkinbio.) #splunklife'

b'Let\xe2\x80\x99s get global. Senior Manager of Sales Engineering, Ayumi Mifune is letting us in on how our Tokyo team is focusing on intersectionality and bringing #EachForEqual to life: \xe2\x80\x9cJapanese society has been focused on diversity efforts for women so far. However, the diversity of Japanese society and also of our Splunk Tokyo office beyond gender is also increasingly important. We need to increase the axis of diversity, where we can, and we are, as a member of team DISCO here in Japan.\xe2\x80\x9d #WomensHistoryMonth #splunklife'

b'Let\xe2\x80\x99s get global. Senior Manager of Sales Engineering, Ayumi Mifune is letting us in on how our Tokyo team is focusing on intersectionality and bringing #EachForEqual to life: \xe2\x80\x9cJapanese society has been focused on diversity efforts for women so far. However, the diversity of Japanese society and also of our Splunk Tokyo office beyond gender is also increasingly important. We need to increase the axis of diversity, where we can, and we are, as a member of team DISCO here in Japan.\xe2\x80\x9d #WomensHistoryMonth #splunklife'

b'#WomensHistoryMonth isn\xe2\x80\x99t over yet, so you better believe we\xe2\x80\x99re still going strong with spotlighting our Womxn+ community. Plano-based Senior Sales & Marketing Operations Manager, Allison Justus-Smith shares more about a role model that paved the way for her personally and professionally: \xe2\x80\x9cMy mom has always been my role model. With a background in technical theater, she entered tech in the 1970s. She had a long and successful career in a period where being a woman in tech was very challenging, even at a progressive company. She had a beautiful and happy family. Total life goals.\xe2\x80\x9d #EachForEqual #splunklife'

b'Loving seeing the faces of our Womxn+ community? Well, you\xe2\x80\x99re in luck \xe2\x80\x93 there\xe2\x80\x99s more to come. Next up, McLean-based Splunker, Delia Olsen, gives us a glimpse at the experiences and passions that make her who she is: \xe2\x80\x9cI am the child of Kenyan immigrants. I have lived and traveled all over the world, including every continent except Antarctica. I run ultra-marathons. I was a competitive dancer. I was a volunteer in the fire department for 5 years. And I coach Special Olympics soccer and basketball.\xe2\x80\x9d #WomensHistoryMonth #EachForEqual #splunklife'

b'It wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be #WomensHistoryMonth if we didn\xe2\x80\x99t give a shout-out to the women who inspire us daily. For Splunker Denada Gjerasi of San Francisco, this hits close to home: \xe2\x80\x9cMy role model is my mom! She is the only parent I grew up with and she taught me the most important values in life without words but with meaningful actions.\xe2\x80\x9d #EachForEqual #splunklife'

b'Want to get to know our Womxn+ community a little better? Say no more. Boulder-based Splunker, Sonal Bablani shares what living the dream [job] is all about: \xe2\x80\x9cDream job? I\xe2\x80\x99d love to run a small independent bookstore and be surrounded by books all day. At Splunk, my dream job is one where I can learn by dealing with new challenges and leave a legacy by making an impactful difference to my team and my product.\xe2\x80\x9d (Psst, for even more #WomensHistoryMonth spotlights, click our #linkinbio.) #EachForEqual #splunklife'

b'One thing we\xe2\x80\x99re leaning on more than ever this #WomensHistoryMonth: community. For London-based Splunker, Ruth Lee, that goes beyond the team she works with every day. She gives a shout-out to the individuals and groups that serve as a constant source of inspiration: \xe2\x80\x9cMy role model is Ali Krieger, for epitomizing what a good attitude and hard work can accomplish in the face of setbacks. At Splunk, my role models are all the members of our Pride ERG leadership team for the endless hard work and passion they put into making this a welcoming place to work.\xe2\x80\x9d #EachForEqual #splunklife'

b"We\xe2\x80\x99re all-in on Splunkers bringing their whole selves to work every day. So you know we\xe2\x80\x99re pretty excited about this year\xe2\x80\x99s #WomensHistoryMonth theme: #EachForEqual. Sydney-based Talent Acquisition Recruiter, Stephanie Zuniga-Maher tells us how she embraces her unique qualities and infuses it into her daily work: \xe2\x80\x9cNo one fits in just one category, and no one is one dimensional. We are not just one thing or one box to tick. I'm more than a woman or black or American or Australian. My identity is comprised of all of those things, plus more. We have to look at people as whole beings.\xe2\x80\x9d #splunklife"

b'Equality, intersectionality, inclusivity \xe2\x80\x93 you guessed it, this is how we\xe2\x80\x99d describe #WomensHistoryMonth at Splunk. Over the next few weeks, we\xe2\x80\x99ll be honoring a few Splunkers around the globe who are persevering to create positive change in our workplace and our world. First, let\xe2\x80\x99s give a warm welcome to our new Chief People Officer, Kristen Robinson, who shares what #EachForEqual means to her: \xe2\x80\x9cTo me, intersectionality means not being defined by one thing - being seen as and celebrating all of who you are.\xe2\x80\x9d #splunklife'

b'And just like that, we\xe2\x80\x99re already at the end of #BlackHistoryMonth. But you know we couldn\xe2\x80\x99t say goodbye without hearing from one more Splunker about a moment that redirected their trajectory as a Black professional. Principal Product Manager, Marvin Green, shares how a moment of excitement for a new opportunity forged a new career path: \xe2\x80\x9cI was an IT program manager in 2010 at GE and my experience at the time covered a range of internal implementations for CRMs, ERPs, and manufacturing systems, and I had the reputation of picking up new areas and delivering value quickly. The product team was looking for a lead for the mobile app development but didn\xe2\x80\x99t find the right candidate \xe2\x80\x93 so the Product GM called me into his office and asked if I wanted to take the role. I said \xe2\x80\x98yes\xe2\x80\x99 immediately without considering my background and fit for the role, and after I left his office, the weight of my decision hit me. I didn\xe2\x80\x99t have any Product Management (PM) or mobile app experience and now I was responsible for GE\xe2\x80\x99s first-ever mobile, consumer-facing app. Cut to a year later, and I was promoted to support the IoT SaaS platform globally and I\xe2\x80\x99ve been in Product Management ever since. I\xe2\x80\x99m super grateful that the team took a chance on me - that one \xe2\x80\x98yes\xe2\x80\x99 redirected my professional trajectory, opened up the opportunity to move to the Bay Area, and now led to me serving as a PM at one of the hottest tech companies in Silicon Valley.\xe2\x80\x9d #splunklife'

b'If you ask us, D&I isn\xe2\x80\x99t just a buzzword, it\xe2\x80\x99s an integral part of our team\xe2\x80\x99s success \xe2\x80\x93 and no one gets that better than Senior Policy Analyst, Pamela Walker. Here\xe2\x80\x99s a moment from her career that reminded her to never let others\xe2\x80\x99 assumptions stop her from achieving her goals: \xe2\x80\x9cWhen I was working for a trade association trying to find a champion to pass legislation that we were seeking, I frequently spoke to a senior member of Congress about sponsoring the legislation. After several phone calls and emails, we decided to meet. During the meeting, I was told they had no idea that I was African American by the way I spoke on the phone. This caught me by surprise since I was on Capitol Hill (but at the time, diversity on Capitol Hill was low). In the end, I was able to get this member of Congress to sponsor the legislation and pass it. This moment reminded me to not let my skin color, gender, or how I speak keep me from getting the job done, and it has led to great career opportunities.\xe2\x80\x9d #BlackHistoryMonth #splunklife'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re back and ready to break down more barriers surrounding the Black professional experience. Next up, Albert Biketi, VP of FCRM & Global Strategic Initiatives, reflects on a transformative point in his career: \xe2\x80\x9cSeveral years ago, I worked on a team covering key initiatives with intense execution requirements. Important projects were dependent on another team\xe2\x80\x99s deliverables, and once I wrote an aggressive email in an attempt to hold a colleague accountable for what I perceived was their team\xe2\x80\x99s failure to deliver, but I soon realized that I lacked sufficient context on the tradeoffs my colleague was working with. I learned a valuable lesson about being coachable, sharing and receiving tough feedback, and repairing relationships when things go wrong. I reached out to the leader, owned up, and she ended up being an advocate for me in my executive coaching. Seek out the learning from every situation and pay forward the goodwill and grace you receive from others.\xe2\x80\x9d #BlackHistoryMonth #splunklife'

b'The path to success \xe2\x80\x93 or even just defining what success is \xe2\x80\x93 is never straight. Internal Communications Manager, Lauren Williams had her own experience that uprooted her personal definition of success and allowed her to redirect her path: \xe2\x80\x9cTwo months after I moved to San Francisco, my Atlanta-based company let me go. I was devastated \xe2\x80\x93 and I questioned how and why this could happen to me. I had always tied my identity to where I went to school, where I worked, etc. and at this moment, none of those things could help me. I had to rely on my inner strength, redefine what \xe2\x80\x98success\xe2\x80\x99 meant and I adopted a new mantra as a result \xe2\x80\x93 \xe2\x80\x98Trust the timing of your process.\xe2\x80\x99 One month later, I landed a job at an amazing company and realized that things will always work out the way they\xe2\x80\x99re meant to and what\xe2\x80\x99s meant for me will never miss me.\xe2\x80\x9d #BlackHistoryMonth #splunklife'

b'You *know* D&I is in our DNA, but how can Splunkers share that experience with other Black professionals? Well, Sales Engineer and former Splunktern, Daunte Baccus, has already \xe2\x80\x98been there, done that.\xe2\x80\x99 He shares about an experience that reshaped his mindset around success and empowerment early in his career: \xe2\x80\x9cI got the chance to talk to STEM majors at Baylor University, University of Texas (Austin), and Wiley College. As a recent Electrical and Computer Engineering graduate, it was inspiring to be in the position to answer questions about transitioning from school to a full-time job and talk about career opportunities at Splunk. My definition of success is being in a position to inspire others and helping them achieve their desired goals.\xe2\x80\x9d #BlackHistoryMonth #splunklife'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re breaking down barriers in a whole new way for #BlackHistoryMonth. In partnership with our Black Employees and Mentors ERG, we asked Splunkers across the country to help redefine the Black professional experience and discuss the experiences that have shaped their trajectory. Ready? Let\'s get to it then - first up, HR Consultant Alicia DeBose shares what redefined her career path: \xe2\x80\x9cThe decision to pursue people management was the career-defining moment that redirected my purpose. My first job out of college as a Client Services Analyst gave me my first \xe2\x80\x98real job experience\xe2\x80\x99...I spent my days speaking with HR managers and became interested in the work they did every day. I just loved the behavioral element of the HR field. Everyone wants to find the perfect career and I\xe2\x80\x99ve found mine in Human Resources. The opportunity I have to make people\xe2\x80\x99s work lives better \xe2\x80\x93 even in a small way \xe2\x80\x93 is the driving force behind my passion." #splunklife'
